abstractText: Habitat restoration projects often include planting trees and shrubs and/or creating conditions to facilitate natural recruitment of woody vegetation. Browse evaluation monitors the impact of browse or utilization of woody species by livestock or wildlife. Observations of browse severity and locations are used to inform browse exclosure maintenance requirements and adaptive management of restored floodplain areas.Data collection methods are described in Woody Vegetation Browse Evaluation Method #1184 [https://www.monitoringresources.org/Document/Method/Details/1184].Browse data are collected in coordination with survival data described in Vegetation Survival Monitoring Method #1308 [https://www.monitoringresources.org/Document/Method/Details/1308].
title: Analysis of Woody Vegetation Browse v1.0
